intro: Soldanella pusilla var. chrysosplenifolia, commonly known as the golden spleenwort, is a small, herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in shades of white or pale pink, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental appeal and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or as a wildflower in suitable climates.
